segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 56
segments.en: Linked Discourses 56

segments.pli: 2. Dhammacakkappavattanavagga
segments.en: 2. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma

segments.pli: 16. Dutiyadhāraṇasutta
segments.en: 16. Remembering (2nd)

segments.pli: “Dhāretha no tumhe, bhikkhave, mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti?
segments.en: “Mendicants, do you remember the four noble truths that I taught?”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, aññataro bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, one of the mendicants said to the Buddha:

segments.pli: “ahaṃ kho, bhante, dhāremi bhagavatā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti.
segments.en: “I do, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yathā kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, dhāresi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti?
segments.en: “How so, mendicant?”

segments.pli: “Dukkhaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ dhāremi.
segments.en: “Sir, I remember that suffering is the first noble truth you’ve taught.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, bhante, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: For if any ascetic or brahmin should say this:

segments.pli: ‘netaṃ dukkhaṃ paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yaṃ samaṇena gotamena desitaṃ.
segments.en: ‘What the ascetic Gotama teaches is not the first noble truth of suffering.

segments.pli: Ahametaṃ dukkhaṃ paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paccakkhāya aññaṃ dukkhaṃ paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paññapessāmī’ti—
segments.en: I’ll reject this first noble truth of suffering and describe another first noble truth of suffering.’

segments.pli: netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: That is not possible.

segments.pli: Dukkhasamudayaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā … pe …
segments.en: The origin of suffering … The cessation of suffering …

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ dhāremi.
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of suffering is the fourth noble truth you’ve taught.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, bhante, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: For if any ascetic or brahmin should say this:

segments.pli: ‘netaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yaṃ samaṇena gotamena desitaṃ.
segments.en: ‘What the ascetic Gotama teaches is not the fourth noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.

segments.pli: Ahametaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paccakkhāya aññaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paññapessāmī’ti—
segments.en: I’ll reject this fourth noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering and describe another fourth noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’

segments.pli: netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: That is not possible.

segments.pli: Evaṃ khvāhaṃ, bhante, dhāremi bhagavatā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānī”ti.
segments.en: That’s how I remember the four noble truths as you’ve taught them.”

segments.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, bhikkhu.
segments.en: “Good, good, mendicant!

segments.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, dhāresi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
segments.en: It’s good that you remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

segments.pli: Dukkhaṃ kho, bhikkhu, mayā paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ, tathā naṃ dhārehi.
segments.en: Suffering is the first noble truth I’ve taught, and that’s how you should remember it.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, bhikkhu, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: For if any ascetic or brahmin should say this:

segments.pli: ‘netaṃ dukkhaṃ paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yaṃ samaṇena gotamena desitaṃ.
segments.en: ‘What the ascetic Gotama teaches is not the first noble truth of suffering.

segments.pli: Ahametaṃ dukkhaṃ paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paccakkhāya aññaṃ dukkhaṃ paṭhamaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paññapessāmī’ti—
segments.en: I’ll reject this first noble truth of suffering and describe another first noble truth of suffering.’

segments.pli: netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: That is not possible.

segments.pli: Dukkhasamudayaṃ kho, bhikkhu … pe …
segments.en: The origin of suffering …

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhaṃ kho, bhikkhu … pe …
segments.en: The cessation of suffering …

segments.pli: dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā kho, bhikkhu, mayā catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ desitaṃ, tathā naṃ dhārehi.
segments.en: The practice that leads to the cessation of suffering is the fourth noble truth I’ve taught, and that’s how you should remember it.

segments.pli: Yo hi koci, bhikkhu, samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṃ vadeyya:
segments.en: For if any ascetic or brahmin should say this:

segments.pli: ‘netaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ yaṃ samaṇena gotamena desitaṃ.
segments.en: ‘What the ascetic Gotama teaches is not the fourth noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.

segments.pli: Ahametaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paccakkhāya aññaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminiṃ paṭipadaṃ catutthaṃ ariyasaccaṃ paññapessāmī’ti—
segments.en: I’ll reject this fourth noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering and describe another fourth noble truth of the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’

segments.pli: netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
segments.en: That is not possible.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho tvaṃ, bhikkhu, dhārehi mayā cattāri ariyasaccāni desitānīti.
segments.en: That’s how you should remember the four noble truths as I’ve taught them.

segments.pli: Tasmātiha, bhikkhu, ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yogo karaṇīyo … pe … ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yogo karaṇīyo”ti.
segments.en: That’s why you should practice meditation …”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.
